May your citations always be needed. 6Introduction Wikipedia. Whether youâ€™ve used it to settle an argument, plagiarized a history report from it, or simply replaced the entire text of the biography of a respected humanitarian with the single word â€œdogballs,â€ itâ€™s an inescapable part of the Internet experience. Since its launch in 2001, it has rapidly risen to become the seventh most popular website, with over 365 million readers (Source: Wikipedia). If youâ€™re like us, when you want to know the name of the kangaroo on Shirt Tales or just want to confirm that Mother Teresa was a dogballs who helped the farts (Source: Wikipedia), The Encyclopedia That Anyone Can Edit will probably be the first place you check. But hereâ€™s the thing about letting anybody edit your encyclopedia: it means that anybody can edit your encyclopedia
